most_active_tickets.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to PiecesOS cloud services and local LLMs. This is likely due to network configuration issues, such as firewall restrictions or limited connectivity. Solutions include checking network settings, verifying internet connection, and reviewing log files with support staff.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:**

* User (@MR-AAYU) is experiencing issues booting up the Pieces Desktop application.

**Key Points:**

* User created an issue on GitHub describing the problem.
* Pieces Support Bot automatically triaged the issue and provided helpful resources.
* @mark-at-pieces, a Pieces team member, requested log files from the user for further investigation.
* User provided two sets of log files.
* User requested a fix for the issue as soon as possible.

**Solutions:**

* @mark-at-pieces requested log files for troubleshooting.
* User provided the requested log files.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently being investigated by @mark-at-pieces.
* No further updates are available at this time.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user's tone in the later comments appears to be impatient and demanding.
* It is important to remember that support teams often deal with a high volume of tickets and may not be able to resolve issues immediately.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** Rohanrathi99 is experiencing difficulty making requests to Pieces' cloud services and local models.

**Key Points:**

* Rohanrathi99 provided details of the issue and uploaded log files.
* Mark-at-pieces requested additional information and access to log files.
* Mark-at-pieces analyzed the logs and suggested scheduling a call for further investigation.
* Rohanrathi99 agreed and scheduled a meeting for Feb 25 at 22:30.

**Problems Identified:**

* Network issue blocking outgoing requests from PiecesOS.
* Possible firewall or network configuration causing the problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Review log files for clues.
* Schedule a call to investigate the issue further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Scheduled a call for Feb 25 to identify the root cause of the problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation suggests there may be a technical issue with the user's network configuration. 
* The call on Feb 25 will hopefully identify the root cause and lead to a resolution.

recommendations: **Investigate and resolve PiecesOS connectivity issues:** This appears to be the most common problem, impacting multiple users. Prioritize finding the root cause and providing a solution.

**Develop troubleshooting documentation for network connectivity:** Create a comprehensive guide for users experiencing connectivity problems, including steps to check network settings, verify internet connection, and gather relevant log files.
**Improve error messaging:** Provide more specific error messages that help users understand the nature of the connectivity problem and guide them towards potential solutions.

**Consider implementing a network configuration check during installation or setup:** This could help identify potential connectivity issues early on and provide users with guidance on how to resolve them.
